intro: Buglossoides glandulosa, commonly known as stickyweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its adaptability, it is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in various environmental conditions.
